subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Heating for a spa pool that shares a water recirculation system with a swimming pool must be by—

ol.li: a heater using reclaimed heat from another process such as reject heat from a refrigeration plant; or

a gas heater that—
if rated to consume 500 MJ/hour or less, achieves a minimum gross thermal efficiency of 86%; or
if rated to consume more than 500 MJ/hour, achieves a minimum gross thermal efficiency of 90%; or

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Where some or all of the heating required by (1) is by a gas heater or a heat pump, the spa pool must have—

ol.li: a cover with a minimum R-Value of 0.05; and
a push button and a time switch to control the operation of the heater.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: A time switch must be provided to control the operation of a circulation pump for a spa pool having a capacity of 680 L or more.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Where required, a time switch must be capable of switching electric power on and off at variable pre-programmed times and on variable pre-programmed days.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Pipework carrying heated or chilled water for a spa pool must comply with the insulation requirements of J6D9.

callout.p: J8D4 does not apply to a Class 2 building and a Class 4 part of a building.
